Title: webapp-config: Insecure temporary file handling
Synopsis:
The webapp-config utility insecurely creates temporary files in a world
    writable directory, potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary
    commands.

Background.Text: webapp-config is a Gentoo Linux utility to help manage the installation of web-based applications.

Description.Text: Eric Romang discovered webapp-config uses a predictable temporary filename while processing certain options, resulting in a race condition.

Impact.Text: Successful exploitation of the race condition would allow an attacker to disrupt the operation of webapp-config, or execute arbitrary shell commands with the privileges of the user running webapp-config. A local attacker could use a symlink attack to create or overwrite files with the permissions of the user running webapp-config.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All webapp-config users should upgrade to the latest version:
